item.title: What happens if the Electoral College goes rogue
Trump says supporters 'vicious'
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump said Friday his supporters were "violent" during the 2016 campaign.

item.title: Republicans on brink of 'Cold War'
item.description: The party of Reagan is fast lurching into a mini-Cold War with itself -- this time over working with Russia rather than against it.

item.title: Electoral College explained
item.description: Are you wondering how the election actually works? Watch this video explainer to find out.

item.title: China will return US drone
Trump pick: Palestinians prefer Israeli rule
item.description: Donald Trump's pick to be ambassador to Israel, David Friedman, said in an interview earlier this year that the Trump administration's approach to the Israeli-Palestinian peace process would be guided by what the Israeli government wants to pursue.

item.title: Heimlich maneuver inventor dies
item.description: Dr. Henry Heimlich, who invented the world-famous Heimlich maneuver to save people from choking, has died Saturday at age 96, his family said.

item.title: 7.9-magnitude quake in New Guinea
Most wanted: $25M reward for ISIS leader
Off-duty soldiers killed in bus attack
Pope celebrates birthday with homeless
item.description: Pope Francis celebrated his 80th birthday Saturday by sharing breakfast with eight homeless people inside the Vatican.

item.title: New twist in Anne Frank mystery
item.description: Who betrayed Anne Frank?

item.title: 70-year-old takes on neo-Nazi hate with graffiti
'Frozen woman' turns out to be ...
item.description: The report to police was deadly serious -- an elderly woman apparently frozen to death inside a parked car in Hudson, New York.

item.title: Three dead as winter storms sweep US
item.description: A brutal blast of frigid air sweeping across the United States wreaked havoc on roads in Virginia and Maryland, leaving at least three dead in multi-vehicle wrecks Saturday, authorities said.

item.title: Nadal hires Moya in bid to climb rankings
item.description: Rafael Nadal has turned to former world number one Carlos Moya in a bid to revive his stalled tennis career.

item.title: Costa heads Chelsea to 11th straight win
item.description: Chelsea's impressive winning run continued in the English Premier League Saturday as a 1-0 victory at Crystal Palace made it 11 straight to stretch its lead at the top of the standings to nine points.

item.title: Obama: This is what no hope feels like
item.description: Following the election of Donald Trump, Michelle Obama said many Americans now know what it's like not to have hope.

item.title: Austrian skiing pride restored in Italy
item.description: Max Franz ended Austria's frustrating 21-month wait for a downhill victory on the men's World Cup circuit by edging out Norway's Aksel Lund Svindal in Val Gardena Saturday.

item.title: Tired? Weak? You're not 'just getting old'
item.description: When Dr. Christopher Callahan examines older patients, he often hears a similar refrain.

item.title: Meet the wrestlers in petticoats
10 of the world's greatest tunnels
item.description: The world's longest, deepest tunnel -- running for 57 kilometers underneath the Swiss Alps -- has finally entered regular service.

item.title: The secret in this masterpiece
Beauty around the world
item.description: To photographer Mihaela Noroc, beauty cannot be defined by one country, race or ethnicity.

item.title: Why the world's extinction crisis is worse than we thought
Luggage that will change the way we travel
item.description: In some weird distant future, suitcase archeologists will surely marvel over the cumbersome bags we once used to haul inappropriate clothing from one side of the world to the other.

item.title: The world's coolest wedding venue?
item.description: Luvattumaa is a hotel carved entirely out of ice in Levi, Lapland.

item.title: How humans get their eye color
item.description: When you're next staring deep into the eyes of your partner, the moment may soon be ruined by the knowledge that, regardless of whether these windows to their soul appear piercingly blue or a shimmering green, the reality is that they are brown.

item.title: Why is this illegal?
item.description: One of 20-year-old Texana Mubaidin's defining features is her elaborate tattoo.

item.title: World's craziest new skyscraper
Finding the real La La Land
The week in 29 photos
item.description: Take a look at 29 photos of the week from December 9 through December 15.

item.title: Chilling designs sculpted from ice
item.description: From the Canadian Prairies to the lakes of Siberia, artists around the world are using an unconventional material -- ice -- in creative ways.

item.title: 'Rogue One': A diversity master class for Trump
What the West can learn from Duterte's war on drugs
item.description: It's so typical of the West to sneer at the actions of what they see as "small brown folk on the other side of the world."

item.title: Has the international system failed Aleppo?
item.description: Seventeen years ago, Kofi Annan stood before the United Nations and apologized.

item.title: Trump's plan? It's the oil, stupid
item.description: With appointments for secretary of state, EPA, Interior and Energy department's, Trump leaves little doubt about his intentions on energy, climate.

item.title: It's time for the Electoral College to fall on its sword
item.description: Amid the last month's exhausting drama around Cabinet picks and presidential tweetstorms, one date stands out -- December 19, the day the Electoral College picks our next president.

item.title: No fees on International Payments

Saving children from life on the streets
item.description: Andy Stein shifts on the balls of his feet, leans against a wooden railing, and fidgets.

item.title: Canadian teenagers sold for sex
item.description: As Lauren Chopek painfully details her story, she does so with the reticence of a survivor, as if somehow remaining silent would have been better.

item.title: Child predator caught by tiny clue in photo
Girls drugged and sold as child brides
item.description: "When I woke up I didn't know that I was in China."

item.title: The '5 disguises' used by human traffickers
item.description: Across the U.S., there is a movement to prioritize human trafficking prevention in our nation's communities. Schools, youth service programs, juvenile corrections services, group homes, and other youth-oriented spaces have begun to recognize their great potential to empower youth to stay safe from exploitation.

item.title: Aleppo's emotional evacuations
item.description: Some civilians and rebels have escaped the war-torn city, but conflicting reports suggest evacuation efforts may not last.

item.title: Heartwarming moments of 2016
item.description: This year has had some lows, but there were also some inspiring moments. Here are some of the most heartwarming ones.
